app.site.pages.oss.ds.description: A large component library for react, developped and documented on Storybook, used internally by most of my apps.
app.site.pages.oss.grc.description: A quick generator of functional components for React, including common PropTypes, defaultProps, internationalization and local module scss.
app.site.pages.oss.gss.description: A quick generator of Storybook v5 stories, compatible with the docs and the PropTypes table, integrates advanced logic such as subcomponents or story decorators.
app.site.pages.oss.swatch.description: A color library for the component era, based on css4 vars and the mutator pattern.
app.site.pages.oss.tgs.description: A template for an Apollo GraphQL Server running on nodejs, serving to interface Sequelize dabatase models with a public GraphQL schema.
app.site.pages.oss.trs.description: A template for a GraphQL / universal React application, to be deployed on Vercel, or be used as an example to build lambda-based infrastructure.
app.site.pages.oss.helpers.subtitle: The following packages are helper packages, for instance, templates or generators. They are simple projects I rely on to be more productive, and have at the moment little to no documentation. (This might change in the future.)
app.site.pages.oss.helpers.title: Helpers and Tools
app.site.pages.oss.libs.subtitle: Production-grade, documented, code libraries for your projects.
app.site.pages.oss.libs.title: Libraries
app.articles.list.title: Articles and Tutorials
app.articles.list.subtitle: Some thoughts about programming, tooling, and walk-through articles about programming ideas I wish I knew earlier.
app.site.pages.contact.description: I look forward to your communication
app.site.pages.contact.title.title: Contact
app.site.pages.contact.title: Contact
app.site.pages.credits.description: The design of this website has been heavily influenced by { workLink } of { kareLink } for Apple in the 1980s.
app.site.pages.credits.fonts: The title font is { headingsLink } by Gilles Booth, an otf reboot of the original Chicago bitmap font by Kare. The paragraph font is Helvetica. I also used icons from the first versions of MacOs and the dingbat font { cairoLink }.
app.site.pages.credits.back_end: As for the back-end, this site is prerendered by a SSR lambda function hosted on { vercelLink } and static files are served from Vercel's CDN, all of this being toroughly cached.
app.site.pages.credits.front_end: On the front-end side, I incorporated the components I developped in my { componentLink }. The site is themed with { swatchLink }.
app.site.pages.credits.go_to_source: Anyway, you can check all of this directly in the { sourceLink }.
app.site.pages.credits.packaging: This universal React application is written in ESM and put together using Webpack and Babel. The source code is continuously integrated and deployed through git.
app.articles.list.all.subtitle: All the articles
app.articles.list.all.title: All
app.articles.list.storybook.subtitle: This series of articles will teach you how to setup your own React component library using Storybook, how to export and import them in a React application using Tree Shaking, and how to streamline the component design while improving your quality pipeline.
app.articles.list.storybook.title: Storybook Series
app.articles.list.contact: If you have ideas or comments about the content, topics you'd like me to write about, { link }.
app.articles.list.contact.link: feel free to drop me a line
